Proxy.name: BOVReaderUI
Proxy.Documentation: long_help="BOV Reader. Reads raw or brick of values files in parallel handles time."

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the file name for the reader.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TimestepValues
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Available timestep values.

StringVectorProperty.name: PointArrayStatus
StringVectorProperty.label: Arrays
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property is used to select arrays to read in.

IntVectorProperty.name: ISubset
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls what subset of data is read in. Subset for smaller memory footprint and better interactivity.

IntVectorProperty.name: JSubset
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls what subset of data is read in. Subset for smaller memory footprint and better interactivity.

IntVectorProperty.name: KSubset
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls what subset of data is read in. Subset for smaller memory footprint and better interactivity.

SourceProxy.name: BOVReader
SourceProxy.label: BOV Reader
SourceProxy.Documentation: long_help="BOV Reader. Reads raw or brick of values files in parallel handles time."

IntVectorProperty.name: MetaRead
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If checked meta mode is active. Meta data will be read and processed however actual read will be deffered to down stream filters. If unchecked the reader performs as expected, an actual read of the requested arrays.

SourceProxy.name: BOVMetaReader
SourceProxy.label: BOV Meta Reader
SourceProxy.Documentation: long_help="BOV Reader. Reads raw or brick of values files in parallel handles time."

IntVectorProperty.name: MetaRead
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If checked meta mode is active. Meta data will be read and processed however actual read will be deffered to down stream filters. If unchecked the reader performs as expected, an actual read of the requested arrays.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Used to set a dataset with vector field to analyze.

InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.Documentation: This input should contian boundary surfaces.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the name of the vector array from which to generate streamlines.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: StepSize
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Step Size
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the step size takein during field line integration.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaxNumberOfSteps
IntVectorProperty.label: Max Steps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum number of steps, beyond which streamline integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaxLineLength
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Max Line Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum streamline length (i.e., physical arc length), beyond which line integration is terminated.

ProxyProperty.name: CutFunction
ProxyProperty.label: Slice Type
ProxyProperty.Documentation: This property sets the type of intersecting geometry, and associated parameters.

IntVectorProperty.name: Resolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the resolution of the seed object.

SourceProxy.name: vtkDistributedFieldTracer
SourceProxy.label: Field Tracer

Documentation.long_help: Integrate field lines in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Integrate field lines in a vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Stream Tracer filter generates streamlines in a vector field from a collection of seed points. Production of streamlines terminates if a streamline crosses the exterior boundary of the input dataset. Other reasons for termination are listed for the MaximumNumberOfSteps, TerminalSpeed, and MaximumPropagation properties. This filter operates on any type of dataset, provided it has point-centered vectors. The output is polygonal data containing polylines.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Stream Tracer filter.

InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.label: Seed Type
InputProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines how the seeds for the streamlines will be generated.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the name of the vector array from which to generate streamlines.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: InitialIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Initial Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the initial integration step size as a multiple of cell lengths.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MinimumIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Minimum Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the minimum integration step size.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum integration step size.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumNumberOfSteps
IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Steps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum number of steps, beyond which streamline integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumPropagation
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Streamline Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum streamline length (i.e., physical arc length), beyond which line integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminalSpeed
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Terminal Speed
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the terminal speed, below which particle advection/integration is terminated.

Proxy.name: vtkOOCFieldTracerUI

Documentation.long_help: Trace field lines in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Trace field lines in a vector field.

Proxy.Documentation: Trace field lines in a vector field.

InputProperty.name: SeedPointInput
InputProperty.label: Seed Cells
InputProperty.Documentation: Cells to generate seed points from (at cell center).

InputProperty.name: TerminatorInput
InputProperty.label: Terminator Surfaces
InputProperty.Documentation: Surfaces which if present stop field line integration when a field line crosses one.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the name of the vector array from which to generate streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.name: OOCNeighborhoodSize
IntVectorProperty.label: OOC Read Size
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Control the size of the OOC reads (context dependent meaning).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: InitialStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Initial Step
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Initial integration step size as a multiple of cell lengths.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MinStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Minimum Step
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Minimum integration step size as a multiple of cell lengths.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaxStep
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Step
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Maximum integration step size as a multiple of cell lengths.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaxNumberOfSteps
IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Steps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Maximum number of steps, beyond which integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaxLineLength
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Length
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Maximum streamline arc length beyond which line integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminalSpeed
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Terminal Speed
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the terminal speed, below which particle advection/integration is terminated.

IntVectorProperty.name: Squeeze Color Map
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the color map to simple where termination due to out of bounds,stagnation, and short integration map to the same case.

IntVectorProperty.name: TopologyMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If checked topology mode is active and the filter produces a topology map rather than field lines.

IntVectorProperty.name: TopologyMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If checked topology mode is active and the filter produces a topology map rather than field lines.

IntVectorProperty.name: TopologyMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If checked topology mode is active and the filter produces a topology map rather than field lines.

IntVectorProperty.name: Use Dynamic Scheduler
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When set the work is by a simple self-scheduling algorithm. In this case all of the seed source data has to be duplicated on all processes. This must be off if this is not the case.

IntVectorProperty.name: MasterBlockSize
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how much work the master does in between servicing work requests from the workers. Should be much smaller the WorkerBlockSize.

IntVectorProperty.name: WorkerBlockSize
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how much work is given to the worker processes at each request.

IntVectorProperty.name: TopologyMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If checked topology mode is active and the filter produces a topology map rather than field lines.

IntVectorProperty.name: Use Dynamic Scheduler
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When set the work is by a simple self-scheduling algorithm. In this case all of the seed source data has to be duplicated on all processes. This must be off if this is not the case.

IntVectorProperty.name: MasterBlockSize
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how much work the master does in between servicing work requests from the workers. Should be much smaller the WorkerBlockSize.

IntVectorProperty.name: WorkerBlockSize
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls how much work is given to the worker processes at each request.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Warp (vector) filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the vector array by which to warp the dataset's point coordinates.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeFaceDivergence
IntVectorProperty.label: Face-Centered Divergence
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Compute divergence using a face centered stencil (Data on CT/Yee cells).

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeCurrentHelicity
IntVectorProperty.label: Current-Helicity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Compute the current/velocity helicity of the vector field using a point centered stencil.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeRotation
IntVectorProperty.label: Rotation
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Compute the rotation of the vector field using a point centered stencil.

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQPlaneSource
SourceProxy.label: Plane

Documentation.long_help: Create a parallelogram given an origin and two points. The resolution indicates the number of division along each axis of the plane.
Documentation.short_help: Create a parallelogram from an origin and two points

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Plane source can be used to add a polygonal parallelogram to the 3D scene.

StringVectorProperty.name: Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Give the object a name that may be used downstream to identify it.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Origin
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinate of the origin (one corner) of the plane.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Point1
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinate a second corner of the parallelogram. The line connecting this point and that specified by the Origin property define one edge of the parallelogram (its X axis).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Point2
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinate a third corner of the parallelogram. The line connecting this point and that specified by the Origin property define a second edge of the parallelogram (its Y axis).

IntVectorProperty.name: XResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of divisions along the X axis of the parallelogram.

IntVectorProperty.name: YResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of divisions along the Y axis of the parallelogram.

SourceProxy.name: vtkSQSphereSource
SourceProxy.label: Sphere

Documentation.long_help: Create a 3D sphere given a center and radius.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Sphere source can be used to add a polygonal sphere to the 3D scene. The output of the Sphere source is polygonal data with point normals defined.

StringVectorProperty.name: Name
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Give the object a name that may be used downstream to identify it.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Center
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the 3D coordinates for the center of the sphere.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Radius
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the radius of the sphere.

IntVectorProperty.name: ThetaResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property represents the number of divisions between Start Theta and End Theta around the sphere. (See the Start Theta and End Theta properties.) The theta divisions are similar to longitude lines on the earth. The higher the resolution, the closer the approximation will come to a sphere, and the more polygons there will be.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: StartTheta
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: To form a complete sphere, the value of this property should be 0 degrees, and the value of the End Theta property should be 360 degrees. The value of this property can be adjusted to form only a portion of a sphere.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: EndTheta
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property can be adjusted to form only a portion of a sphere. This value is measured in degrees.

IntVectorProperty.name: PhiResolution
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property represents the number of divisions between Start Phi and End Phi on the sphere. (See the Start Phi and End Phi properties.) The phi divisions are similar to latitude lines on the earth.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: StartPhi
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: To form a complete sphere, the value of this property should be 0 degrees, and the value of the End Phi property should be 180 degrees. The value of this property can be adjusted to form only a portion of a sphere. Set the starting angle (in degrees) in the latitudinal direction.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: EndPhi
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property can be adjusted to form only a portion of a sphere. The value is measured in degrees.

SourceProxy.name: vtkProcessMonitor
SourceProxy.label: Process Monitor

Documentation.long_help: A custom Qt panel that manages and monitors the running processes.
Documentation.short_help: A custom Qt panel that manages and monitors the running processes.

SourceProxy.Documentation: A custom panel that manages and monitors the running processes.
